description-en: Mahatma Gandhi can be seen on this poster from the Empire Calendar Manufacturing, sitting on front of a Buddha statue, holding a book- the Bhagavad Gita. (sp)

explanatory comments/crosstagging: While the version of this print available in the Priya Paul Collection does not have a title, other copies that I have seen bear the title given here (For example, Singh, Amrit Kaur, and Rabindra Kaur Singh. 2003. Images of Freedom. New Delhi: Indialog Publications, p. 66). The artist M. L. Sharma’s work was quite popular with print makers between 1932 and 1950, so this image as well may belong to that period. The print appears to suggest that the sources of Gandhi’s non-violence might be the Buddha and the Bhagavad Gita (the book he is shown holding in his hands). (Sumathi Ramaswamy)(gs)
